projects.description: A project developed for the fourth summative of my course, where I created a CMS website for The Kindness Institute, a non-profit organization. The site allows users to engage with the cause through donations and purchasing products from a curated online catalog. Built with a focus on functionality, security, and SEO optimization, the project includes a custom WordPress theme with client-friendly content management features and is fully responsive across all devices.

A project developed for the second summative of my course. I created an accommodation finder website for Taupo, allowing users to filter options and find their ideal accommodation. The website was built using HTML, JavaScript, SASS, and Swiper, focusing on a seamless user experience.

A project developed for the first summative of my course, where I redesigned the Wellington Botanical Society's website using HTML, JavaScript, and CSS. The goal was to create a modern, user-friendly interface, showcasing my front-end development skills with a strong focus on responsive design.

A website showcasing a collection of Asian dramas I've watched over the years. It allows users to filter and sort dramas by country, genre, and actor/actress. Built with HTML, JavaScript, SASS, Mapbox, Axios, and Swiper.js.
